column5: I have one of those big Ontario {lodge} maps and can not find this lodge listed. Where is it? How is the fishing at the end of June/start of July? Muskies? Walleyes? Northerns?Thanks
Its in the northeast part of Lac Seul at Chamberlain Narrows. About a 30-35 mile boat ride from the landing at Deception Bay. Good spot but the camp is a bit rustic.

when you say it's a bit rustic, what do you mean. i just booked a week in august for me and my wife. can i assume they have flushers and potable drinking water from the faucets. how's the fishing around there. thanks for the info.

flushers, yes....they have three german shorthair pointers that really flush the pheasant out of the bush. they also have portable drinking water....only a short walk from the lake to your cabin using old gallon milk jugs. enjoy your trip.
Camp used to be rustic but is as nice as it gets as the ownersKen and Brenda have dumped in tons of money. It's housekeeping and has all the amenities.
